text: A lady ate and drank cheerfully and had all that her heart could desire, and she desired to live forever. For the first hundred years everything was fine, but then it began to shrink and wrinkle, until it could neither walk nor stand nor eat nor drink. But he couldn't die either. At first she was fed as a little girl, but she became so tiny that she was put in a glass bottle and hung in a church. It's still there, in St. Mary's church. It's the size of a rat and it moves once a year. FIN FIND European anonymous
title: Vivir para siempre
author: nan Anónimo
